sentence.text: Those Georgian buildings were slums ; we felt it was wrong that anyone should have to live in them .
It 's wrong that everybody is not treated the same way .
Mary got stroppy about it and said it was wrong what they were doing , it was a desecration .
` It was wrong what I did to her and I will take my punishment for that .
It was wrong what he did but he should be shown compassion . "
How can he convince his wife that it 's wrong to spank her boys ?
It would be wrong to suggest otherwise .
However , according to the attitudinist , nothing merely factual can be formally inconsistent with a pure ethical statement like ` It would be wrong to steal that money " .
The Government had now come to believe , however , that it was wrong to have a penalty regime which was almost entirely automatic .
He was wrong to get involved as he did .
But perhaps she was wrong to mock him : he had found her , got into her flat and persuaded her to answer his questions .
You 'll be telling me next I 'm wrong to interfere . "
The estate agent is selling for a third party and it would be totally wrong that his client should suffer because of the false window-dressing of his agent .
As Montag begins to realise how wrong his community is , he starts to steal a few books rather than burn them all .
My mother was quite capable of making the journey but , because of her age , I had felt that it would be wrong for me to allow her to undertake it .
And that 's why it is wrong for women to be financially penalised when they have children .

They encapsulate the democratically arrived-at beliefs both that it is wrong for animals to suffer in such ways , and also that legislation will lead to an amelioration in the behaviour of farmers and poachers .
It has been argued that it is wrong for such a body to impose even a limited check on the activities of an elected Government .
` Beth was wrong in what she did , I wo n't deny that , and I do n't know if I can ever forgive her .
This was wrong of me , I acknowledge it . "
How wrong of you to bring me away from the main road !
That was wrong of me , but it in no way mitigates your own actions .
Sheriff Crozier said yesterday that it would have been wrong of him to deal with the matter behind the scenes .
He felt some shame in digging up long-dead ghosts to torment Vologsky , and a sense of moral wrong in telling him such a bundle of blasphemous untruths .
He told Angel clearly that he was wrong in parting from Tess .
